paragraph.paragraph: The 2.5 release of EiffelEnvision brings with it a wealth of improvements and enhancements to existing features, present in previous releases of Eiffel ENViSioN!, aswell as a huge number of additions. The items mention here are only some of the major additions and improvements made to EiffelEnvision. For a complete taxonomy of changes in EiffelEnvision please review the url*EiffelEnvision 2.5 Version History document.
The first notable change is that EiffelEnvision has had a name change. In previous release EiffelEnvision was known as Eiffel ENViSioN! (Eiffel for .NET for Visual Studio .NET)

One of the biggest changes in EiffelEnvision 2.5 is it's change to the way projects, and their files, are managed and configured. Projects are now subdiveded into 4 logical sections creating a clear distinction between project component reference, project files and items, Eiffel libraries and a group of miscellane items. In addition project url*Cluster management, used to manage url*Eiffel Class source file, has been integrated directly into the url*Solution Explorer, providing the simpliest and most direct means possible of file management.

The way projects are configured has changed also. EiffelEnvision 2.5 abstracts a number of Project Configuration Properties, to create a set of Common Properties, in order to faciliate users in configuring projects faster and with less errors when changing between vxconBuildConfigurations 0 Build Configurations . In addition to this abstraction a number of addition project Configuration Properties have been added, such as Eiffel url*Debug Clauses and advanced properties to tweak compilation.

EiffelEnvision has had many improvements and optimizations made to the url*Build/Compilation process. EiffelEnvision projects build faster than ever before. Not only has the Eiffel compiler been enhanced to compile your Eiffel for .NET source files, but EiffelEnvision has a new build-as-needed mechanism. EiffelEnvision projects are now compiled as required, alloing url*Eiffel Class Library projects to be added to your vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog 0 Solution without pelanty. Regular projects also benifit from being built-as-needed; compilation are smaller and reduce overall compilation time, or sometimes requiring no compilation at all.
For changes to the Eiffel compiler, please see url*Eiffel Compiler Version History

The url*Eiffel Editor has been vastly improved and enhanced over previous versions of Eiffel ENViSioN!. The editor is now an vcovrAutomaticStatementCompletion 0 Intellisense feature complete editor, and comes complete with a url*Feature Index List and fully automatic url*Source Code Outlining. In addition to these new features, the ability to url*Synchronize Class View has been added and url*Go To Defintion and url*Completion have been greatly improved to produce better results.

With the new revision of the whats_new.xmlsolution_explorerSolution Explorer, EiffelEnvision integrates more seamlessly with deconUsingSourceCodeControl 0 Source Code Control . Management of your project's source files and be controlled from with Visual Studio .NET and EiffelEnvision automously. There are no more additional configuration files to concern yourself with, and nothing else you have to consider when intergrating EiffelEnvision projects into a deconUsingSourceCodeControl 0 Source Code Control controlled repository.

EiffelEnvision projects now provide even more to the integrated Visual Studio .NET DALGProjects 0 Setup and Deployment Projects . With better dependency evalauation and more deployment options available, url*deploying projects created using EiffelEnvision is now simpler than every

New to EiffelEnvision 2.5 is the url*EiffelStudio to EiffelEnvision Project Conversion Tool. The tool replaces the Import from EiffelStudio project in previous versions of Eiffel ENViSion!. The tool integrates into the Windows shell provding conversion directly from Windows Explorer. The tool is also much more feature rich than it predecessor, allowing both classic Eiffel and Eiffel for .NET projects to be converted/imported into EiffelEnvision with the push of a button.

There are many, many, many more additions, enhancements and improvements in EiffelEnvision 2.5, which through reading this documentation, or using EiffelEnvision, you will discover. EiffelEnvision will be intutive for those who have used Visual Studio .NET before and have a knowledge of the url*Eiffel Langauge. For those whom have not used Visual Studio .NET before should become acustom to the plethora of features it provides, which EiffelEnvision integrates into and expands upon. For those who have not yet used Eiffel and this is your introduction to it, then it is recommended you become familar with the url*Eiffel Langauge and read url*An Invitation to Eiffel.

We sincerley hope you enjoy the new features of EiffelEnvision 2.5,
EiffelEnvision 2.5 Team.
